content.webTitle: TV tonight: Glenda Jackson battles dementia in a new thriller

fields.headline: TV tonight: Glenda Jackson battles dementia in a new thriller
fields.bodyText: Elizabeth Is Missing 9pm, BBC One Glenda Jackson stars in this feature-length adaptation of Emma Healey’s bestselling 2014 novel about an elderly woman attempting to solve the mystery of her disappeared friend. Jackson plays Maud with a heartbreaking tenderness as her dementia worsens and her past experiences increasingly fuse with the present – especially the previous disappearance of her own sister. It is Jackson’s first TV role for 27 years and a welcome return to the small screen in this not-so-festive yet engrossing drama. Ammar Kalia Seven Worlds, One Planet 6.20pm, BBC One Africa provides the finale for David Attenborough’s latest triumph, offering cheetahs using training-ground moves to pull off a hunt and an elephant whose one weird trick helps it survive in the desert. Fascinating, with a shaming message about conservation to finish. Jack Seale Not the Robbie Williams Christmas Show 8pm, ITV Fresh from the release of a gloriously cheesy Christmas album peppered with laughs (among them a duet with boxer Tyson Fury), Robbie continues his festive exploits. This one-off promises classic hits, plus cameos from celebs including Jamie Cullum and David Walliams. Hannah J Davies I’m a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here! Final 9pm, ITV It has been a classic year for I’m a Celeb, with all the ingredients of TV gold. Caitlyn Jenner served up gossip from the Kardashian empire and Ian Wright was tortured by trials. Tonight, your king or queen of the jungle will be crowned, despite the fact Nadine Coyle is already the people’s princess. Hannah Verdier The Killing of Jessica Chambers 9pm, Sky Crime Our true-crime fascinations seep into real life in this documentary series following the 2014 death of Jessica Chambers, found outside her burning car in rural Mississippi. With no clear suspects, a group of online sleuths set to work to try to find her murderer. AK Alex 12.05am, Channel 4 Corrupt cop Alex spent the first season of this Swedish drama trying to turn his life around and stop living a double life, but ended up killing a police officer anyway. He begins this new series in a maximum-security prison, caught between the choice of becoming an informant or joining a criminal gang. AK Film choice Nebraska 1.05am, Channel 4 Alexander Payne’s grainy black-and-white odyssey has Will Forte’s thirtysomething son reluctantly agreeing to take his ailing dad (Bruce Dern) on a 750-mile fool’s errand to Lincoln, Nebraska to collect a bogus $1m lottery prize. Dern is marvellous as Woody Grant, irascible but endearing. Paul Howlett Live sport Premier League Football: Aston Villa v Leicester 2pm, Sky Sports Main Event. Dean Smith’s men take on Brendan Rodgers’s high-flyers. Scottish League Cup Final: Rangers v Celtic 2pm, BT Sport 1. The Old Firm rivals battle it out. Snooker: UK Championship 7pm, BBC Two. Concluding coverage of the final at the Barbican Centre in York.
